cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northeast and approach Florida’s Big Bend, then accelerate northeastward across Georgia and the Carolinas and move into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida Big Bend coast near Indian Pass/Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend and eastward across the peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds possible (32% chance of ≥34 kt, peak onset probability 18% Thursday afternoon/evening).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground possible in Tampa Bay including Manatee County Port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches likely with isolated amounts up to 15 inches over the central Florida peninsula, including the port area, leading to flooding potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Flash flooding of low-lying terminal areas; brief tornadoes embedded in outer rain bands are possible.
